intro: Linkia splendens, commonly known as the golden star or silver leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often variegated with white or silver markings. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Linkia splendens is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
